data.title: Number of Ghouls
data.solution:
h = int(input())
a = [*map(int,input().split())]
n = input()

if h != 0 or sum(a) != 0:
    P = str(round( 100 * a["CBAS".index(n)] / ( sum(a) + h ))) + "%"
else:
    P = "0%"
    
print(P)
data.statement:
Tokyo Ghoul is a series of action and fantasy books. In this book, there are two types of people, humans and ghouls.

Ghouls are classified according to their dangerousness in different categories:
C,B,A and S.
(There are also SS and SSS but to simplify the example, we will put SS and SSS in the "S" class)

Your goal is to calculate the probability [[P]] of running into a Ghoul of class [[N]]  (if you run into one person)  knowing how many Humans [[H]] and Ghouls there are of all classes[[C]],[[B]],[[A]] and [[S]].

Example:
Number of Humans [[H]]: 5
Number of Ghoul C,B,A,S: 5 3 2 0
Class of Ghoul: C
There are 5+5+3+2=15 people.
Knowing that there are 5 ghouls of class C in the sample, the probability of falling on a ghoul of class C is 5/15 = 33%.
data.stubGenerator:
read H:int
read C:int B:int A:int S:int 
read n:word(1)

write Touka !
data.inputDescription:
Line 1: [[H]]: Number of Humans (<<int>>)
Line 2: [[C]],[[B]],[[A]],[[S]]: Number of Ghouls by class
Line 3: [[N]]: Class of the ghoul (<<char>>)
data.outputDescription: [[P]]: The probability of meeting a ghoul of class [[N]] if one crosses a single person a <<string>> with probability <<rounded>> to the nearest integer

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Tokyo Ghoul is a series of action and fantasy books. In this book, there are two types of people, humans and ghouls.

Ghouls are classified according to their dangerousness in different categories:
C,B,A and S.
(There are also SS and SSS but to simplify the example, we will put SS and SSS in the "S" class)

Your goal is to calculate the probability P of running into a Ghoul of class N (if you run into one person) knowing how many Humans H and Ghouls there are of all classesC,B,A and S.

Example:
Number of Humans H: 5
Number of Ghoul C,B,A,S: 5 3 2 0
Class of Ghoul: C
There are 5+5+3+2=15 people.
Knowing that there are 5 ghouls of class C in the sample, the probability of falling on a ghoul of class C is 5/15 = 33%.
Input
Line 1: H: Number of Humans (int)
Line 2: C,B,A,S: Number of Ghouls by class
Line 3: N: Class of the ghoul (char)
Output
P: The probability of meeting a ghoul of class N if one crosses a single person a string with probability rounded to the nearest integer
Constraints
0 ≤ H ≤ 10000
0≤ C,B,A,S ≤ 100
N can be 'C' or 'B' or 'A' or 'S'
Example
Input
5
5 3 2 0
C
Output
33%
